dialogues.text: as they watch the new arrivals. They ride caution,

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Look at them. This madness has spread like plague. By the time we reach Bari to sail east, it is said we'll be fifty thousand strong.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Less one. I leave tonight for the land of the Slavs.

dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: To live from what I steal.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: What’s to steal from the Slavs? Moldy bread? Putrid sausage from stinking villagers?

dialogues.text: I don't rob villagers.

dialogues.text: I won’t serve Emmich. for a beat and Ari speaks again with a sense of

dialogues.text: Only a fool allows the troubles of his past to ruin the joy of his future. Stay with this crusade. Rob yourself rich, and be blessed rather than hanged for it. Hagen says nothing. Ari removes a purse from his waist.

dialogues.text: We've already made some denarii. Half is yours. He tosses it to Hagen,

dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.text: My old clothes?

dialogues.text: (Laughs) ...and some odds and ends I snatched from a clothes line. Both men laugh.

dialogues.text: A city stripped of food...Our victory feast will be on jackal and carrion crow. Emmich looks down as several women, some with infants in arms, extend their hands and beg for food.

Emmich is immediately behind with Ivo and Waldemar. are followed by a congregation of knights. Adhemar stands before the makeshift altar. dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: Months of siege are now rewarded by peace and the restoration of order. Let us now pray for further victories. Godfrey rises.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: Bishop! How can our prayers be answered until we purge ourselves of those who have committed heinous sins.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: Count Godfrey, this is not the time nor place for such declarations.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: I believe God has limits to what he allows in his name. What he has done to innocent civilians... Godfrey points at Emmich.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: ...He must be disavowed of his oaths and cast from this crusade. There is a chorus of “No’s” from the knights and from the and file. Baldwin of Chartres steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: BALDWIN
dialogues.text: Without Emmich we'd have starved. Sensing the support of those gathered, including knights Baldwin formerly loyal to Godfrey, Emmich faces his accus

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Can you deny that cruel acts are a fact of war? (more)  am 72. EMMICH (Cont'd) We ravage lands and leave death and destruction, yet we are favored with victory. Is it not proof that because our goal is just, the Lord forgives our actions? There are shouts from the men “Yes!...The Lord forgives,...Emmich has fought bravely!” Godfrey pushes to Adhemar.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Denounce his savagery. Cast him from us.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: We can’t afford to lose him. We can't afford to fail. Adhemar raises his hand to quiet the men.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: Silence. The Lord alone will judge us...If we restore Jerusalem to his kingdom, God will forgive what we have done for his cause. Cheers. Emmich turn with his fist raised and shouts.

dialogues.text: Hear that, men? Whatever we do he'll forgive us! Adhemar turns, avoiding Godfrey’s look, and resumes the m From cheers and shouts of “Death to the Moslem filth,” th knights go to bendec knees and muttered prayers. INT. dialogues.text: ...I have twenty thousand Askaris to defend the walls, and at Antioch they had twice that number. DJARVAT, thin and dark with intense burning eyes, stands the pool, draped in the black robes of a fundamentalist m He listens as Iftikhar speaks.to Ibn Khaldun.  73.

dialogues.text: Emir Khaldun, you are skilled in warfare. Advise us. Draft a plan for. our defense.

dialogues.text: Find a means to slaughter these infidels before their stench defiles our shrines. Ibn Khaldun smiles at Djarvat's fiery rhetoric.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: Our horsemen and archers are superior to theirs. If it is to be a battle we should meet them in the field.

dialogues.speaker: IFTIKHAR
dialogues.text: But the cost of mounting such a force... AKIVA, an elderly Rabbi, speaks from among a group of Jew elders.

There is some disgruntled mumbling among the gathering. - crosses toward a repuisive, elephantine pudding of a man reclines near a large tray of sweets. He is DUQAQ of Dama and his portrait did not begin to suggest his depravity. retainer al-Afdal stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: Our gracious friend Dugag commands an army of horsemen and archers...Only a day’s ride away. Dugaq licks a sweet from his fingers as he faces Djarvat.

dialogues.speaker: DUQAQ
dialogues.text: The soldiers of Damascus are only for the defense of Damascus.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: The pillage of Moslem shrines by infidels means nothing to you?

dialogues.speaker: DUQAQ
dialogues.text: (a smug smile) Djarvat, as you mullahs are fond of reminding me, I am not a pious man. : : (more)  74. DUQAQ (Cont'd) (he searches for another sweet as he speaks) But there is something that might entice me to defend Jerusalem. Emir Khaldun knows of my desire. The men exchange glances as if caught by a riddle.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: He means my daughter, Leila.

dialogues.speaker: IFTIKHAR
dialogues.text: Then give her, and blessed by the union. The others chime in. “Yes, give him the girl.”

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: I have promised my daughter that in marriage her will is to be her own.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: No woman's will is her own. Dugaq appears insulted. There is a general grumbling from assembled. .

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: For a daughter‘s pride are we to bear desecration of our faith?

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: Christians coming to pray will not desecrate Islam. We should examine the possibility of a truce.

dialogues.speaker: IFTIKHAR
dialogues.text: These are barbarians. War is inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: of the wars I've fought none were inevitable, ...All were regrettable. Ibn Khaldun faces the others and continues.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: We of this city are wise in the skills of negotiation and compromise. We have played conquerors before, ...as others play chess. (more)  78. IBN KHALDUN (Cont'd) These Christians are exhausted by their long struggies, weakened by their journey, beset with quarrels and intrigues,...I say we meet them and offer peace.

dialogues.speaker: IFTIKHAR
dialogues.text: Let them enter the city without a fight?

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: Enter unarmed as pilgrims, to worship. By the Prophet's law, all faiths worship here.

dialogues.speaker: AKIVA
dialogues.text: ...We are all the children of Abraham. We Jews support an effort for peace. Djarvat laughs out loud in mockery.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: You Jews will die with this coward by the same Christian sword. Allah calls for victory, not compromise with infidels. Djarvat and his following walk away. There is a beat of s then Iftikhar speaks. IFTIKHAR . Go, Ibn Khaldun,...Save us if you ean.

dialogues.text: the Crusaders lift their lances. The Moslem horsemen do t same. AL the trumpet’s call, the knights lunge ahead with the c "God wills it!” Ibn Khaldun leads the Moslems downhill with the call, “LA ILA ALLAH!”  104.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATTLE
dialogues.text: The two mounted armies, each shouting the battle cry of t faith, drive toward each other and collide at full gallop Ibn Khaldun’s lance drives into the eye-slit of a knight' helmet and out the back. Emmich deflects the lance of a Moslem charger and swipes man with his sword, disemboweling him. Godfrey slays his opponent, but all around him, Moslems d the Crusader knights in a one-sided battle. Baldwin of Chartres is run through the chest. Moslem archers ride the flanks of battle, picking targets shoot as they stand in their stirrups or from beneath the bellies of their horses as they swing beneath. Godfrey shields himself against the rain of arrows, but o are hit. Horses rear and fall. An arrow strikes Emmich’s arm, He yanks it out. The instant the arrows stop, Moslem riders charge from th opposite side. Before the Crusaders can turn their mounts are struck by Moslem swordsmen.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT AND HIS HORSEMEN
dialogues.text: break through Crusader- lines and penetrate into the hear the camp. Shouting “Allah Akbar!*, they hack down peasant footsoldiers.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR AND THE MONKS
dialogues.text: sink to their knees and pray, awaiting martyrdom. Women, children, and peasants have formed a ring of prayer aroun

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: blocks the downward blow of an Arab scimitar with his scy handle and with a loud WHOOSH cuts off the Arab’s arm. Ha drops the scythe and takes the scimitar from the detached Now armed with a legitimate weapon, Hagen wades through t of battle. Dodging the colliding haunches of horses, he h down an enemy footsoldier, then puts on the chest armor f a fallen Crusader knight. Before the armor is secure, a M swordsman attacks from the rear on foot, but Hagen blindl slices his throat with a dervish-like backward spin. Hagen grabs a round Moslem shield from the ground and wit motion parries the attack of two more Moslem swordsmen. Defeating them, he exchanges his scimitar for a straight Crusader broadsword which he takes from a dead knight.  105. The sword and its hilt make a cross. Hagen kisses the bla fortified to have his accustomed weapon.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE REAR OF THE BATTLE,
dialogues.text: Arab archers launch flaming arrows into the Crusader camp

dialogues.speaker: THE CENTER OF THE CAMP
dialogues.text: is suddenly illuminated by burning missiles. Arrows arc o a landscape of dead and dying, striking tents and carts w burst into flame. It seems the fires of Armageddon have c Adhemar turns to Brother Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: This is our punishment. God has forsaken us.

dialogues.speaker: OVERWHELMED AND OUTNUMBERED,
dialogues.text: the Crusader knights fall back.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH,
dialogues.text: fighting savagely, is knocked off his horse by a mighty b

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: rides among the ranks of men, exhorting them to fight,

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: Turn back and fight! Christ fights with you!

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Three archers lined up in a row take aim at some Crusader Hagen charges them with his broadsword, running them thro like a kabob. He places his foot near the hilt of his swo and draws out the fully-buried blade. He finds a dead Frankish knight and exchanges his Moslem for a kite-shaped Crusader shield. He puts on Crusader sh armor, and yanks the open-faced helmet from the dead Crus head. Hagen is starting to look like himself again.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH,
dialogues.text: horseless, wades among the ranks of men, using his sword drive terrified soldiers back to battle.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Fight until the arrows find you!  106. Some drop to their knees and take up the hymn of martyrdo Emmich prods them to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Fight! Or beg for death when they pound stakes up your ass!

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: looks around and sees a Moslem footsoldier trying to moun Crusader horse. He slays the Arab and heaves himself into saddle. He shoves the helmet over his head. Now Hagen is once more a complete knight.

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE CLOUD OF SMOKE,
dialogues.text: backlit by flames, engulfs the camp. Moslems flash by on horses like demonic shadows.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUSADERS
dialogues.text: are retreating en masse.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: wheels around on his horse and sees a Crusader on the gro besieged on all sides. Seizing a pike from a footsoldier, gallops to save him. Using the hook, he snatches a Moslem off the knight and h him away. He stabs another with the pike. The Crusader struggles to his feet. Turning to face Hagen lifts his helmet and laughs. It’s Emmich. Ivo rides up with a horse for Emmich, and he mounts, stil laughing at Hagen as he retreats before the Moslem onslau

dialogues.speaker: EVEN GODFREY
dialogues.text: must retreat as Ibn Khaldun’s knights rout the Crusaders into their smoke-enshrouded camp.

dialogues.speaker: ONLY HAGEN
dialogues.text: holds his ground. Engulfed by the advancing Moslem cavalr he fights like a berserker. Then he disappears into the spreading smoke.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUSADER ARMY
dialogues.text: degenerates into panic. Soldiers turn tail and run. Other kneel around Adhemar, ‘praying as they await final martyr  107.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT AND HIS HORSEMEN
dialogues.text: charge the circle of prayer, slaying unarmed monks with g relish.

dialogues.speaker: THE MADMAN
dialogues.text: retreats with the army, spouting nonsensical prophecy. Lo over his shoulder, he sees something so astounding that h running, stops ranting ~- and watches in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall of smoke a remarkable vision appears. Projected onto the dark cloud by the backlight of the set sun is the huge mounted silhouette of a Crusader knight o horseback -- a gigantic SHADOW WARRIOR. The Shadow Warrio fights off Moslems who attack him two and three at a time

dialogues.speaker: THE MADMAN
dialogues.text: siezes fleeing Crusaders and violently forces them turn a

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: Look! Look! Monks and peasants cross themselves upon seeing the holy apparition.

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: Christ! On the clouds of heaven! The Lord has come! A hysteria spreads through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: _. VOICES
dialogues.text: Jesus is here! Christ has come to deliver us!

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY, EMMICH, ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: stare at the giant silhouette, struggling to comprehend i meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Moslem Horseman charges out of the cloud of smoke direc at CAMERA like the angel of. death, sword held high, shou in Arabic -- the epitome of jihad. The Shadow Warrior turns toward the terrifying Saracen an throws his sword like a javelin. The sword flies out of the dense smoke and strikes the Mo through the back like a thunderbolt. When the Moslem keel forward, the sword arcs straight up like a triumphant cro surrounded by a mystical aureole of sunlight.  108.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH AND GODFREY
dialogues.text: gasp in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: _ GODFREY
dialogues.text: God is with us! Turn and fight!

dialogues.speaker: / EMMICH
dialogues.text: Fight, you cowards! God wills victory! Knights pick up the cry, “God wills it." Like a wave, the resolve to fight spreads through the entire army.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHADOW WARRIOR
dialogues.text: rides out of the cloud and the smoke around him disperses Madman is the first to recognize him. It is Hagen!

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: Hagen! Hagen is Lord! Maranatha!

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: retrieves his sword from the Saracen’s back. When he look he sees that half the Crusade is staring at him in awe. H pauses for a breath, then raises his sword high.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Fight for your lives! Follow me} Hagen turns his horse and leads the Crusaders in a charge

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: is astounded to see the Crusaders riding toward him. At t threshold of victory, the Moslems hesitate. And in that m the tide of battle shifts. Trumpets blare, rallying the Christians.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN, GODFREY, EMMICH
dialogues.text: lead the way, riding in small groups into a sea of Moslem Inspired by faith, the Crusaders battle fearlessly, savag pressing forward,

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAVILY ARMORED KNIGHTS
dialogues.text: close on the more lightly armored Saracens. Fighting in t quarters, the Moslems are overpowered.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN AND HIS KNIGHTS
dialogues.text: slowly retreat before the onslaught, filling the gaps, br fighting but losing ground.  be ° .o

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: are attacked in the middle of the camp by peasants and footsoldiers wild with the scent of blood. With their pikes and and clubs and shovels, the lowest of Crusaders overwhelm the black~robed horsemen, pulling sev to the ground and mashing them to a pulp. The peasants converge on Djarvat and try to drag him out saddle. He hacks at them, but the Crusaders keep coming. Djarvat panics. DJARVAT . Retreat! Retreat! These Christians are possessed! Djarvat wheels his horse and trampels those who hamper hi retreat. He and his black-robes gallop through the camp, pursued b fanatical Crusaders.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: watches in disbelief as Djarvat and his men flee the fiel battle. Many of his beleaguered knights, seeing this betrayal, ab their orderly retreat and flee for their lives. A BODY OF CRUSADERS . pursue the routed Moslems, inflicting terrible losses.

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN,
dialogues.text: abandoned by half his army, fights on with the stalwart r Hagen sees Ibn Khaldun in the middle of the fray and driv horse towards him. Ibn Khaldun sees Hagen. Their eyes meet and Hagen shouts.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Leila escaped! She is safe!

dialogues.speaker: IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: No! Djarvat has her still! Hagen is astounded. Ibn Khaldun nods with shared regret. Ibn Khaldun looks around and sees there is no hope. He tu to Hagen, a face he can.trust. He shouts to his color gua

dialogues.speaker: / IBN KHALDUN
dialogues.text: Strike colors! Strike colors!  110. The banners are thrown down. Hagen yells at the Crusaders around him. .

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Give them quarter! They surrender! Some of the men back off. Godfrey echoes the shout.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: They’ve struck their colors! Give them quarter! Suddenly, there is a blood-curdling shriek. Emmich, Ivo, and a party of his men ride on the Moslem co who have now lowered their swords. Ibn Khaldun manages a look toward Hagen as he is cut down by Emmich. Hagen rides into the tray and restrains two Crusaders, bu is powerless to stop the bloodbath. He turns away from wh quickly becomes a slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANTS AND FOOTSOLDIERS
dialogues.text: flood forward with their tools and weapons to beat the li the remaining Moslems as they desperately scramble for es Crusader women and children join the fray, chasing a craw Moslem, hacking at him with sickles and hoes. Hagen reacts with disgust while knights laugh and shout encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: turns and looks at the pitiful remnants of a Mighty Arab Bitter and ashame@, he rides for the hills with the survi

dialogues.speaker: AROUND HAGEN,
dialogues.text: the cry, “Jerusalem, God wills it!" begins and becomes a But Hagen is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Hagen washes his face beside a stream. In the dist the cries and chants of the Crusaders can still be heard. Sitting back he removes the “Hand of Fatima” which Leila him, Holding it in his palm, he thinks of Leila. In a sudden rage, Hagen tears at his white tunic decorate the crimson cross, symbol of the Crusade. He rips the gar in two and throws it’on the ground. Then behind him he hears a SOUND. Hagen’s hand goes to hi weapon. Rising, he peers into the surrounding forest and  lll.

dialogues.speaker: A WHITE HORSE
dialogues.text: staring at him from the foliage. The animal nickers and s out, It wears a bridle, saddle, and blood-stained trappin emblazoned with crimson CROSSES.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN SMILES
dialogues.text: recognizing his old mare that was lost when he sailed fro

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: It’s you. The white horse nods and steps forward. Hagen steps to it strokes its head.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: What a smart girl you are. How did you find me? The mare nuzzles him. Hagen glances again at the Hand of which he still holds.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Tf you can find me, I can find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen returns to the camp leading the white horse, from w he has removed all the trappings. There is a celebratory around him. Crusaders drink and carouse in victory. The harlot’s cart is doing a land office business. The Madman sees Hagen and proclaims his arrival.

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: The Saviour! Hagen of the Cross! Deliver us from evil! Crusaders of all types turn toward Hagen, cross themselve touch him reverently. Many fall in behind Hagen, followin as he walks. Hagen ignores them all, wanting no part of this Crusade.

dialogues.speaker: BROTHER BERNARD
dialogues.text: emerges from the shadows ahead and calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: BROTHER BERNARD
dialogues.text: Hagen,... Brother Bernard approches him.

dialogues.speaker: BROTHER BERNARD
dialogues.text: Bishop Adhemar sent me to find you. His wound is quite grave. There isn’t much time. Hagen nods wearily and follows the monk. His unwelcome entourage trails behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen, still wearing body armor, steps into a large tent. Monks kneel in prayer around Adhemar's bed. A triangular mask of black velvet embroidered with a silver skull is b the pillow. Brother Bernard whispers to the old man that has come. Adhemar, breathing in short gasps looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: Hagen,... Hagen says nothing. He waits uneasily as Adhemar whispers Brother Bernard who motions the others to leave. Adhemar gestures Hagen to sit beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: Sit by me. Hagen sits. Adhemar reaches out and touches his arm. ADHEMAR ; I am dying. Help me to die in peace. Hagen looks at the old man, at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: I fear deeply that I have failed God. I am tormented by the horrors,...by the suffering, that i have allowed in his name. Hagen sees the mortal terror in Adhemar’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: You are chosen by God. It must be you who takes the Cross.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: The cross?  113.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: The True Cross in the Holy Sepulchre. Take it and rule. You alone are blessed. Hagen agonizes over what he can say. Finally.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: No, Bishop, I am not blessed. Adhemar shakes his head in a denial of Hagen’s words. He Hagen’s arm with a sudden rush of strength.

dialogues.speaker: ADHEMAR
dialogues.text: You bear his sign. Follow God's will.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: I know nothing of God’s will. Hagen speaks without looking at Adhemar.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: The cross on my back is a brand that I burned on myself to escape hanging. My dream was alla ie... Hagen turns to Adhemar.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: I deceived you. Adhemar lies with his eyes open. He is dead, but his expr implies he is at peace.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN RISES
dialogues.text: from the bed and backs away. A monk moves past him from t door, kneels, and begins praying. Another crosses to Adhe closes his eyes and places the death mask over his face. Hagen moves away the tent gradually fills with clergy, in prayers for Adhemar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge choir sings praise of the Lord as the vast army of Crusaders descends from the hills surrounding Jerusalem. domes of the city gleam like gold in the sun’s first rays

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: walks at the lead, barefoot, wearing a monk’s robes. Behi him his large contingent of loyal knights follow in penit procession.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH RIDES ON HORSEBACK
dialogues.text: at the head of his large camp of conquerors. HAGEN IS NEXT, ASTRIDE HIS WHITE HORSE. But following him, the Madman whips himself with a scourg few steps ahead of a legion of followers -- hundreds of footsoldiers, peasants, and humble knights, all fanatical devoted to the miraculous Hagen of the Cross. The sight of the walled city excites them to a frenzy. Ma throw away their shoes and stumble ahead, their bare feet and bloody from the rocks. Some crawl on their knees in penitence, Hagen stares at the city trying to peer through the walls Trying to see Leila. Emmich drops back and waits for Hagen. Hagen ignores him, Emmich walks alongside.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Hagen, I’m in your debt. You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: No, brother. Even enemies can be useful to*each other. Hagen glances suspiciously at Emmich, who nods toward God

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: What do you gain if Godfrey becomes king? A handful of coins?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Whatever I can take.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: If I wear the crown, you’ll have my lands in France. Our father’s estate will be yours. Hagen’s eyes betray a flash of interest.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: You're a liar.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: What need will I have for a hillside of grapes when I’m sitting on Herod's throne? We’ll never see each other again.  115. Hagen walks on a few steps.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Only your love. -- And the loyalty of those who follow you. Emmich glances back at Hagen‘s large army of supporters. thinks for a moment, then turns amicably to Emmich.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Brother, before I see you King of Jerusalem... {a beat) I'll wear the crown myself. Hagen smiles at him a beat, then marches forward. Emmich stops in place, seething, as Hagen‘s army streams him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moslems hoot and jeer from the heights of the walls as Cr knights begin the construction of siege towers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Citizens under the supervision of the city’s guard pile b of cotton against the gates. Masons are walling across streets to make interior barric A CLATTER OF HOOVES. Djarvat, iftikhar the Governor, and seven horsemen ride a through the streets. They stop at the gates of Ibn Khaldun’s palace and Djarva clearly the leader of Jerusalem, shouts to a guard. The g open and they enter. INT. IBN KHALDUN’S PALACE - A COURTYARD ~ DAY Leila, in a veil of mourning, faces Djarvat in a small courtyard, surrounded by his black-robed minions.

dialogues.speaker: _ DJARVAT
dialogues.text: Dugeq still desires you. Tomorrow, you will leave for Damascus.

dialogues.speaker: LEILA
dialogues.text: I would rather die. Djarvat indicates two of his men.  116.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: They will see that doesn’t happen. You should thank me, princess,... Dugaq promises to rout these Christians. After your father's defeat, you might restore some honor to your name.

dialogues.speaker: LEILA
dialogues.text: My father sought peace. He died with his honor intact, a victim of your deception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a darkened room Ari peers through the filigree and lis as Djarvat gives final orders to his men,

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT, (IN THE B.G.)
dialogues.text: watch her carefully. I'11 arrange your departure for dawn.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN,
dialogues.text: apart from other workers, swings an axe, cutting logs int usable shapes as part of the huge construction effort. As works a LONE MONK, whose face is hidden under a raised co walks nearby spouting verse to encourage the workers.

dialogues.speaker: LONE MONK
dialogues.text: Heed the Revelations! Wherein it tells of Jerusalem's fall: “Forward Pilgrims, death to all who have offended Christ!” Hagen doesn't look up or pay attention as the Monk approa delivering his final Pyords almost directly into Hagen’s

dialogues.speaker: LONE MONK
dialogues.text: “Leave not woman nor child! Exterminate the filth and bring the day of redemption.” Have you the stomach for it, Knight?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: looks into the Monk's face.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONK
dialogues.text: is Ari. After a quick smile of recognition, he grabs Hage arm.

dialogues.speaker: _ ARI
dialogues.text: Come Knight! Pray with me.  117. Ari moves Hagen a short distance away and kneels, pulling down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Have you seen Leila? Is she well?

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: She is captive in the palace. Djarvat rules now.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: The battle begins tonight. Tell her to stay hidden till I arrive. ARI . Hagen, Leila is in danger even beyond this madness. -- Djarvat has sold her to Dugaq. She’ll be carried to Damascus at dawn. Hagen stands and ponders what to do.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Take me to her. Now. Ari grabs his arm and holds him.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Wait. There is a way through the walls, But not before sundown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By firelight huge siege towers are pulled by hundreds of toward the the walls. Emmich exhorts his team to greater effort.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Pull! Soon you’ll all be rich}

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE WALLS
dialogues.text: There is a sudden eruption of fireballs into the night sk

dialogues.speaker: THE FIREBALLS ARC
dialogues.text: out and strike among the Crusaders who pull the towers. They break, spreading flame like napalm. A fireball breaks on the tower itself, setting it afire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Djarvat orders squads of Moslem soldiers to quickly load balls, each with a burning fuse, into catapults. Another barrage of Greek Fire (fireballs) is launched.  118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godfrey commands a bucket brigade that hoists buckets up towers to control the fire.

dialogues.speaker: REPLACEMENTS,
dialogues.text: Monks, commoners and even women, step over the charred bo of fallen comrades and take the ropes. Singing the anthem “Congregati sunt” they drag the siege tower toward the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireballs, launched from the walls above, explode near tw running figures, illuminating Ari and Hagen. They scramble for cover in the rocks as arrows, some tipp flame, whistle down on them from the walls. Ari pulls Hagen down into a crawlway. They move on their bellies and enter a hole through the rock that leads belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sliding down a steep slanting face of stone, Ari splashes shallow water at the bottom. Hagen comes down in a contro slide behind him. Ari removes a ball of fire wool from his shirt and an oil torch. In the moonlight from the entrance he strikes a fl and lights a fire as Hagen gazes around. THE LIGHT OF ARI‘S TORCH ILLUMINATES a room where they stand ankle deep in filthy water. Anima bones are strewn throughout.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: It was built to drain the blood of sacrifices from the Temple of Solomon,...I played hide and seek here when I was a child. My first holy relics were gathered from these bones. Forced to a crouch, Hagen follows Ari into a passageway.

dialogues.speaker: IN A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Under a hail of stones, arrows and Greek Fire, the siege are inched to the walls. A carpet of dead lays strewn beh showing the path they took.  119. Soldiers crank the launcher of a mangonel. Emmich supervi as his men whip Moslem prisoners, forcing them to boost a rock into the catapult. dialogues.text: The stone shatters a wall and collapses a section of roof Djarvat, killing the Moslem archers who use it for cover. Djarvat barely escapes being crushed by a stone.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE WALLS
dialogues.text: Emmich laughs then turns, facing the Moslem prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: More rocks!

dialogues.speaker: A PRISONER
dialogues.text: There are no more, Effendi. Emmich stares at them in rage. He shouts to Ivo.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Use their heads. Emmich and the other Crusaders attack the unarmed prisone hacking at them. Heads are piled into the launcher. The catapult springs.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE WALLS
dialogues.text: Djarvat and his troops are struck by a barrage of human h Iftikhar climbs onto the parapet, tripping over the grisl projectiles. He approaches Djarvat in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: IFTIKHAR
dialogues.text: Send the princess now! We need Dugaq’s army! Djarvat looks from his demoralized defenders to the infla Crusaders below.

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: Stay here. I'‘11 deliver her myself. . He climbs down a ladder, leaving Iftikhar in command.  120.

When the danger has passed they run for Ibn Khaldun’s pal

dialogues.text: to the oil-soaked rags on the tip of a giant, ten-foot ar that protrudes from a massive, cannon-sized, crossbow. A second arrow is lit on another giant crossbow. A third.

dialogues.text: Fires burn in the entry of the palace. A burning arrow cr through the ceiling. Djarvat and four of his men hold Leila as bricks and burn timbers fall around them. She struggles to get away and h smacks her. He shoves her down a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtyard is lit by the glow of fires from the burnin palace. Djarvat and his men emerge with Leila between the

dialogues.speaker: DJARVAT
dialogues.text: (shouting orders) Tie her on the horse,... (to another man) Ride ahead to the Gate. Keep it open! Leila spits in his face. Djarvat kicks her in the stomach the men drag her to the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full assault begins. The siege towers are pushed to the walls. Under a hail of stones and Greek fire, the Crusade knights climb the towers.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE TOWER
dialogues.text: squads of crossbowmen, archers, and soldiers, hurling bur pitch, launch a fusillade against the Moslems guarding th wall, only twenty feet away.  121.

dialogues.text: men cranking wheels that extend the bridge are doused by oil. They fall away but others quickly take their places.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE TOUCHES THE WALL
dialogues.text: and Godfrey shouts the command to charge. Led by Emmich, knights in heavy armor walk across the bridge, swinging t swords, hacking a swath through the Moslem guards.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: (shouting) To the Temple Gates! Open the gates!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen, Leila, and Ari are swept along in a sea of terrifi civilians. They turn and run toward the Wailing Wall. At an intersection, they see the Temple Gate open, Crusad footsoldiers pour through. Civilians, women and children, chased and hacked down by the frenzied footsoldiers. Hagen, Leila, and Ari stop at the corner of a building an for a beat at the massacre.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Oniy one place is safe. The Holy Sepulchre. They'll spare the Christians. They turn and, following him, race away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE JEWISH QUARTER
dialogues.text: Jews run from their houses as Crusaders swarm the streets torching whatever will burn. The Hermit Monk climbs to a rooftop holding a staff with cross atop it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIT MONK
dialogues.text: The Jews that murdered our saviour! Kill them! Exterminate the name of Israel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen, Ari, and Leila run along a street littered with Je dead. At a cross street they see---

dialogues.speaker: JEWS,
dialogues.text: flock from all directions toward their synagogue. Most we prayer shawls and carry books of prayers. Singing can be from within as the masses press toward the doors of the building.

dialogues.speaker: ARI STOPS COLD IN HIS TRACKS
dialogues.text: and watches them. The shouts and cries of Emmich and the approaching Crusaders can be heard. “Death to the Jews,.. to the enemies of Christ!” Ari suddenly gasps, seeing-- Yacub, his uncle, wearing a prayer shawl and holding a To Yacub hurries toward the synagogue among the others.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Oh, God... {shouts) Yacub! Ari shouts again for his uncle, who doesn’t hear him. ari to Leila.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Princess, you know the way to the sepulchre?

dialogues.speaker: LEILA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Go without me.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Go! Hagen takes his arm. Ari pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle is a Jew. -- And so am I. Hagen looks at Ari for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: He needs me. Go! Ari kisses Hagen and draws back.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: We’ll meet again, Ari launches himself into the crowd, fighting his way tow his uncle, shouting his name.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOORS OF THE SYNAGOGUE,
dialogues.text: Yacub stops and turns. He sees Ari.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Wait! Don't go in! Yacub struggles to stand in place as the mob of panicked crushes him into the synagogue.

dialogues.speaker: A SQUAD OF CRUSADERS
dialogues.text: emerges from a side street firing with crossbows.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN AND LEILA -
dialogues.text: duck back as arrows slam around them. They crouch as a se barrage of arrows sticks in the doorway above their heads Hagen shelters Leila as they are forced back toward the s of a side street.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOORS OF THE SYNAGOGUE,
dialogues.text: Ari reaches Yacub and tries to pull him away. The press of the mob is too strong. They are forced insid Crusaders slam the doors closed behind them and seal the entrance with a large timber.

dialogues.text: As Hagen and Leila race down a street they are suddenly confronted by SEVERAL FOOTSOLDIERS hurling booty from a h

dialogues.speaker: FOOTSOLDIER
dialogues.text: That Moslem beauty should be shared my friend. Hagen cuts down the leader and holds the others back with sword as he and Leila pass and continue down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The square is a litter of bodies of Jews who did not make to the synagogue and were cut down by Crusaders. The Hermit Monk, sword in hand, kills alongside the other Emmich, panting with exhaustion, swings halfheartedly at pleading masses that surround him, Then he stops and look at the synagogue. From inside the sound of singing can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIT MONK
dialogues.text: They still worship. Burn them! Burn the temple. . The cry of “Burn Them,” is taken up by the others.

dialogues.speaker: IVO AND OTHERS
dialogues.text: push a cartload of hay beneath the doorway of the synagog set fire to it. The soldiers cheer and shout as it blazes up. GODFREY’S MEN OPEN A GATE IN THE CITY WALL, and horses are driven into the city. Crusaders rush to mo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmich stands before the synagogue watching it burn. Ivo beside him.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: We’ve done good. Ivo Emmich, the street of the gold smiths...There’s jewels, treasure of all kinds,... Horses are led into the square by Crusaders. Emmich and I saddle up.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: There’s only one treasure here. The True Cross. The man who has it has the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christians and Moslem refugees, mainly women and children the courtyard of the Sepulchre through a large gate.  126. Huge flaming bolts arc across the sky and strike the surr buildings.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, THE SEPULCHRE WALL
dialogues.text: Hagen and Leila have reached the gate. In the background, pours from the foolscap dome of the Sepulchre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen and Leila press through the gate. They are guided b monks and nuns to shelter under the archways of the surro buildings. Hagen looks toward the burning church. A bucket brigade o monks is trying to put out the flames. HAGEN’S GAZE comes to rest on the door of the Holy Sepulchre. Smoke po from inside and Hagen reacts as---

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD MONK, THEODOSIUS,
dialogues.text: appears through the smoke. His eyes desperately search th crowd, the young, the old, the feeble. But his penetratin finds Hagen. He points at him and calls out.

dialogues.speaker: THEODOSIUS
dialogues.text: You!...Come!

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN,
dialogues.text: amazed, starts toward the monk.

dialogues.speaker: THEODOSIUS
dialogues.text: You have strength. Help us save the cross. Hagen, stricken by the old man’s words, glances at Leila, steps to the doorway. The old monk stares at him through the swirling smoke. Hi words are indistinct in the roar of the flame.

dialogues.speaker: THEODOSIUS
dialogues.text: TI am Theodosius. God has sent you. He turns into the smoke-filled entrance, and Hagen follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire licks at tapestries and icons as monks work a bucket brigade in a futile effort to control it. Above, the roof timbers are ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagen, Collowing Theogosius, sees the altar through smoke flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silver cross stands before the Mosaic of Abraham. A bea suddenly drops from the ceiling and fire rises, obliterat it from view. Then, magically, it reappears. HAGEN PUSHES TO THE ALTAR. He steps through burning rubble. Flames scorch the silver he reaches the cross. At the center of the silver cross is a piece of ancient blackened wood, the remains of the True Cross. Hagen grabs the cross member with his hands. He winces. H hands are burned at its touch, but he holds it and slowly it from the altar and settles it onto his back. At the touch of the hot metal, his shirt burns away and h groans with pain as he struggles with his burden.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONKS FIGHT
dialogues.text: back the flames with buckets of water as Hagen carries th cross toward the door. Theodosius walks ahead, guiding hi through the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmich and his men ride to the outer door of the compound ram is brought forward and slammed against it. The door collapses and they ride into the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmich leads his men into the courtyard and his look goes straight to the Sepulchre.

dialogues.speaker: LIKE AN IMAGE FROM A RELIGIOUS PAINTING
dialogues.text: Hagen appears through smoke and flames carrying the cross

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUSADERS AROUND EMMICH
dialogues.text: are stricken. They stare, amazed, as--- HAGEN STEPS FROM THE SEPULCHRE. Staggering under the weight, he descends the steps, with Theodosius and monks following.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HEAD LOWERED, HAGEN
dialogues.text: is unaware of Emmich. As he walks he hears the clanking o armor, Looking up, he sees---  128.

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHTS
dialogues.text: ease themselves off their horses and drop to their knees sight of Hagen.

dialogues.text: is completely awestruck,

dialogues.text: Emmich remains mounted, but many of his men, so stricken image of Hagen and the True Cross, push forward a reach t the relic.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Pathetic fools! Kill him! None respond to Emmich.

dialogues.text: Theodosius and the monks who now surround him. HAGEN . Take the Cross! Hide it where no crusader will ever find it! At Theodosius’ command, a dozen monks lift the Cross from Hagen’s back. As they take it away, Hagen draws his sword

dialogues.text: Seize the Cross! Emmich looks down to see Ivo on his knees, praying alongs all the others. The Madman cries out in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: Hagen is king! King of Jerusalem! Hagen is king! In a mad fury, Emmich draws his sword, rides over Ivo, an pushes his sword through the Madman’s back.

dialogues.speaker: THE MADMAN
dialogues.text: collapses onto the ground. With blood dripping from his m he casts a last worshipful look at his hero.

dialogues.speaker: MADMAN
dialogues.text: Hagen...

dialogues.text: reins his horse around and faces Hagen.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH
dialogues.text: Yes...Now!  129. He charges Hagen, who meets him in a two-handed stance. E first swing misses. He swings around for another.

dialogues.speaker: LEILA WATCHES
dialogues.text: the unequal battle from the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: EMMICH TRIES
dialogues.text: to trample Hagen. Hagen is knocked down. Emmich’s horse r and stomps him, but he manages to roll away and spring ca to his feet. Emmich charges, and Hagen retreats toward the colonnade t lines the courtyard. Emmich swings, but Hagen darts behin column. Emmich maneuvers around the column, hacking at Hagen and him into the open. As Eaunich charges again, Hagen jumps the raised porch of the church and swings his sword with his strength. The blade catches Emmich just below the rib severing his head, sword arm and upper torso in one piece Sword still in a hand, a horrible battle cry bursting fro lungs, Emmich’s upper trunk falls to the dust of the cour The horse squeals in panic and rears with Emmich’s lower in the saddle. It turns and gallops out the courtyard gat the streets of Jerusalem with the ghostly half-Emmich sti the saddle. HAGEN WATCHES . the horse disappear, then he rams the blade of his sword the dirt and breaks off the blade. He crosses to Leila and takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: IN A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Fires still burn and a deathly veil of smoke hangs over t city. From somewhere in the streets a chorus of a thousan voices sings an anthem of victory. The burned ruin of Al-Aqsa mosque looms in the foreground a huge procession passes the lifeless square. The Hermit Monk, now in the robes of a bishop surrounded acolytes swinging censers of incense, leads a solemn marc the victors through what was once a living city. They ste bodies and limbs and slog through puddles of blood. The gold cross atop his-staff floats through swirls of sm against a background of fire and devastation.  130.

dialogues.text: Hagen, on foot, leads two horses packed for travel. Leila wearing a veil, is mounted on one. They emerge onto a square near the burned ruins of the synagogue. The area is littered with Jewish dead. A few p of burning bodies are tended by black masked soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: gazes toward the ruins of the synagogue. Something on the ground catches his eye. He reaches down and lifts a yarmu As his thoughts go to Ari the singing is suddenly louder THE CRUSADER PROCESSION APPEARS. Godfrey rides at its head, followed by Ivo and other prom knights, united in victory. Hagen’s expression betrays disgust, and the same can be r in Leila’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: sees Hagen. He leaves the others and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: Hagen, come to the Holy Sepulchre. I am to be crowned king. I promise there will be a high place for you in my realm.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: You'll wear a crown of gold where Christ wore a crown of thorns? Godfrey hears the innuendo but chooses to ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: Join us in giving thanks to God for the glory of this conquest.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: What glory?

dialogues.speaker: GODFREY
dialogues.text: Our victory has restored God's kingdom. Hagen reacts to the outrageous irony of Godfrey’s words.

dialogues.speaker: HACEN
dialogues.text: God‘s kingdom. Hagen looks around at the piles of dead and the burning r that surround the plaza.  131.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Take a look around. Take a deep breath and with the stench of death in your nose, go tell God you've restored his kingdom. Hagen turns and leads the horses away from the procession Godfrey, fighting whatever wells from his own conscience, away and begins singing the Latin words of the anthem. EXT. dialogues.speaker: . PEDDLER
dialogues.text: Christian,...Christian, wait! Hagen ignores the Peddler and keeps moving, but the man p

dialogues.speaker: PEDDLER
dialogues.text: When you leave this holy city would you not want to carry a piece of the True Cross? Surely you of all knights have earned it for your valor. Hagen turns at the familiar ring of the man’s words.

dialogues.speaker: A DIRTY FACE
dialogues.text: smiles up at him. Hagen beams. It's Ari.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Ari! Hagen hugs him and looks him over. Ari is pretty badly br and burned.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: I found a way out for my uncle and ten others. Ari shrugs as Hagen shakes his head, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: And you? No crown? No treasure?

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: we'll live as I was born to live, from the land.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Sad, you had such promise as a thief... He takes Leila’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: And these soft hands, Princess, tilling the soil? . LEILA . They will harden as we raise erops... And children.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN
dialogues.text: Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: No, I have my trade. And with so many pilgrims, it’s good. Already I’ve sold three hairs from the beard of John the Baptist. Hagen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: When you return with the bounty of your harvest, come find me. I'll either be at the mosque, the temple, or the sepulchre... wherever the faithful are gathered. Another embrace and Hagen and Leila leave. EXT. DAVID’S GATE - OUTSIDE THE WALLS - MORNING Hagen leads the horses out of the city. In the background deserted siege towers can be seen along with a few scaven picking through the dead.

dialogues.speaker: HAGEN GLANCES AROUND
dialogues.text: and they start on the road away from the city. Hagen take Leila’s hand and looks up at her. He smiles, kisses her h then climbs onto his horse.
